We construct the Lie algebra of a Lie group, where the bracket is given by the vector field bracket of invariant vector fields associated to an element of the Lie algebra, i.e., the tangent space at the identity. The Jacobi identity follows from the fact that it is satisfied generally by the Lie bracket of vector fields.

Along the way, we define the Lie bracket of vector fields, first in vector spaces and then in manifolds. This is only well defined when second derivatives are symmetric, which holds for `C^2` maps over reals or complexes, and for analytic maps otherwise. Since analytic manifolds are part of the manifold hierarchy in Mathlib, we can formulate this as a single result, requiring the manifold to be of smoothness index `minSmoothness ùïú 2` (which is `2` over reals or complexes, and `œâ` otherwise). 

In the same way, our construction of the Lie algebra of a Lie group makes sense when the Lie group is `C^n` for `n = minSmoothness ùïú 3`.
